name: The Weinhard Hotel

reviews.text: Many "historic" hotels show their age; rickety "antique" furnishings, cranky plumbing, tired decor and less than pristine housekeeping - not so at the Weinhard Hotel!
reviews.title: Unexpected gem!

reviews.text: The period furnishings are wonderful, the bed and pillows were very comfy; I was appreciative that I didn't have to smell previous guest odors within the pillows or linens, it happens so often even in chains these days and is really gross!
reviews.title: Like time travel with modern amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bath was attractive with a floor of white hexagonal tile with a good showerhead and plenty of water pressure.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom had a high ceiling with a drop ceiling fan, very nice wall trim and a useful good wooden window blind. There are plenty of lamps and light and a flat TV with every channel possible.
reviews.title: First-rate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was not an errant speck of dust, an unrepaired crack, a badly painted baseboard or soiled spot of carpet to be found.
reviews.title: A GRAND STAY!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanting to take a spring drive in the country and have a laid back little getaway, we chose to travel to Dayton and stay at the Weinhard Hotel. Everything about the hotel was perfect but I also want to just mention what a pleasant little town Dayton is. Great restaurants, nice little walking trail along the river, lots of parks and it enjoys the warm sunny climate of south eastern Washington.
reviews.title: A Very Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, for the inn. We stayed in room #15 located on the second floor with a little balcony. Yes, the view could have been better, it looks out at the wall of the building next to it, but gracing the top of that building, you get a glimpse of the historic court house and treetops. The room is also just off the rooftop garden where we enjoyed a nice beverage and relaxing in the sun or shade.
reviews.title: Comfortable with GREAT location

reviews.text: The complimentary fresh fruit (apple, pear, banana and orange) along with the yummy dark chocolate was a nice surprise. The beautiful antique bed was comfortable with good linens and a variety of pillows, shower/tub nice, good space for toiletries on the vanity. My wishes for the room? I would have liked a small table so we could enjoy our coffee and breakfast in the room with the morning sun coming in the french doors and a refrigerator like the other rooms had would have been appreciated. But, the staff was so, so wonderful. I had bought some jasmine tea pearls at the shop across the street and one of the staff at the hotel provided me with a nice little teapot and cup so I could enjoy it, even though they sell tea and espresso also.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: We will definately come back. It is so well done and well run and a very pleasant surprise to find this gem in a rural setting.
reviews.title: A wonderful surprise from beginning to end!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent the weekend in Dayton at the Weinhard Hotel. What a great city and hotel. The Hotel was really more like a bed and breakfast in that it was comfortable, you were treated like part of the family, and there were fresh muffins when you woke up! NOT TO MENTION the terrific location within Dayton. Once you parked, everything else (well, almost) was within walking distance. There were a least 4 great restaurants within a block, a 'to die for' chocolate shop (don't miss this one), and an interesting purveyor of mead! The mead maker actually walked our purchase back to the Hotel, so we could stay and chat some more. The rooftop at the hotel was also very relaxing and a great use of space. WE will definitely come back to this hotel as well as Dayton.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I had been wanting to get to Dayton for years and was so pleased with this great little town. Not too many towns in Washington are "picturesque" but Dayton surely is. My stay at the Weinhard was good except for the fact that the bar across the street closes late Saturday nights and what with the loud music from inside (which carried across the street) and shouting outside, I got to sleep only after closing. Best to get a room off the main street weekends if you are a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Great but if you are light sleeper.....

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Weinhard Hotel several times over the last few years. The accommodations are refreshing, relaxing and very clean. The owners are lovely people and we really enjoy talking with them when we stay. The hotel and furnishings are beautiful and the rooftop garden is wonderful! We have stayed in various rooms on the first and 2nd floor and found each one to be very comfortable. The sheets are luxurious and the fruit basket with chocolate in the room is a nice touch. Even with 2 picky boys, we all find something to eat and drink at the continental breakfast. We look forward to our next stay at the hotel!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!

reviews.text: We were lucky enough to stay at this very good hotel at the Vacation Cottage. We were profoundly pleased with the furnishings, facilities and decor of this cottage. Had a super time at Dayton and enjoyed meeting the owners. Recommend this hotel to anyone....a real bargin.
reviews.title: Great hotel and even better owners

reviews.text: Spent a lovely evening and night in Dayton, including dinner at Patit Creek, and sleeping in the lovely rooms of the Weinhard. Was a perfect end to an ambitious day. The warmth, generous hospitality matched the lovely sheets, warm towels and delightful continental breakfast the next morning. The Roof Garden is beautiful, and a lot of nice touches (fire pit, blankets to keep warm, comfortable seating for many to gather around the fire). We always enjoy coming back, and are delighted with the many nice touches that continue to be added. Well done, all!
reviews.title: Weinhard Hotel, Memorial Weekend 2012

reviews.text: Dayton is a sweet charming town and this hotel shows what travel accommodations were like a 100 years ago. A Victorian jewel with up to date services. I stayed in a handicap accessible room and it was perfect. A fruit and chocolate basket in the room was a special touch.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.text: Take a step back in time and enjoy the Weinhard Hotel on your next visit to Dayton Washington. They have lovingly restored this property. The rooms are good size with original high ceiling and beautiful carved bed frames and dressers. The wood banisters and stairs are polished to a bright glowing shine. The roof garden is the perfect setting for that before dinner glass of wine. It faces the hills and the sun was shinning on the fresh cut wheat land. What a treat.
reviews.title: Step Back in Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning they had coffee, muffins and fruit ready for your consumption before heading out on your morning walk of the restored town.
reviews.title: Very pleasant visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't miss staying at this hotel on your next visit to Dayton.
reviews.title: Comfort with a Little History

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Weinhard and enjoyed it thoroughly. Gary checked us in and offered friendly, helpful advice about restaurants, etc. There were cider, crackers, & cheese in the lobby (late afternoon). Our room was plenty large (#3) and well appointed, including a little frig. The ceilings were very high, so it felt extra roomy. We heard no hotel or outside noise during the night--although we had the AC fan on, so it could have masked noises. The morning continental breakfast was adequate--coffee and muffins were very good. We were totally satisfied. If you have time, take one of the walking tours of the nearby historic neighborhoods--really interesting.
reviews.title: The Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The original owners did a magnificent job restoring this historic three story building, plus roof top garden. Our phone conversations with the staff had been most enjoyable, and we were greeted warmly. The hotel is wonderfully furnished with antiques. Our room was comfortable; the bed having high quality sheets that may be ordered for purchase. However, underneath the warm, spotless elegance were some details that might be addressed. Guests are welcomed with fruit and a piece of chocolate in their rooms. Ours had no chocolate. Being chocolate lovers we mentioned it. Our host at the desk seemed not sure about believing us, and then said the "we are training a new girl." A minor thing but how things are handled matters. Most disappointing was breakfast, which basically consisted of cereal and muffins on a serving board, with the rest in a fridge. Weak coffee is served, but a stronger brew must be must be purchased. While many inns and hotels sell odds and ends, there seemed to be just a hint of excess in this area. Such a lovely place should try to be sure that what guests receive matches the impressions given by the building and its history, which is beautifully written and presented in a booklet in each room. All in all good value for the price, breakfast excepted. One last note. Rooms on the front, right on main street may be noisy for light sleepers.
reviews.title: Charming in every way

description: The Weinhard is a 15 room Victorian Hotel. Each room is uniquely appointed with antique furnishings. All rooms include a private bathroom, cable TV, wi-fi internet access, telephones and hair dryers. A fresh fruit basket is provided in your room each day. Complimentary muffins, oatmeal, juice, coffee and tea are served in our coffee shop each morning, where espresso drinks are also for sale. Our rooftop garden is a nice spot to relax during your stay.
